contest-event.event-date:
June 14, 1946 D Stalybridge (Whit Friday)
Stalybridge (Whit Friday) 0 March Contest Whit Friday Tameside stalybridge-whit-friday
Up to around 1967 this contest was held on the market square in Stalybridge, but was moved indoors one year when the proverbial biblical rain storm occurred. Was held in the Town Hall for a number of years before it moved to its present location at Stalybridge Labour Club I think about 25 years ago (but dont quote me on that). Although we have it recorded as two different contests it is a continuation and is still reported in the local press as being Stalybridge contest.
Market Ground, Stalybridge, Cheshire Prizes - 1st £12, 2nd £7, 3rd £4. Result as in Brass Band News July 1946, showing Fred Berry as conductor of Brighouse, same column showing Mossley contest result has Eric Ball as Brighouse conductor. 16 bands competed.
Oct. 29, 2016, 6:55 a.m. Feb. 8, 2019, 2:05 p.m.
1 Brighouse and Rastrick Band Fred Berry
2 Tintwistle Band J. M. Hinchliffe
3 Black Dyke Band Arthur Oakes Pearce
